item.title: Melissa McCarthy, the Cast of ‘S.N.L.’ and more Attend American Museum of Natural History Gala
item.description: It was all gratitude for the prehistoric beasts that once roamed the earth at the American Museum of Natural History gala in New York.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vadukul
item.media:credit: Krista Schlueter for The New York Times

item.title: Francis Ford Coppola’s F.P. Journe Sells for $11 Million at Auction
item.description: Frenzied bidding pushed the polarizing F.P. Journe timepiece into near-record territory despite one dealer calling the design “goofy.”
item.dc:creator: Jacob Bernstein

item.title: Versace Announces Dario Vitale’s Shocking Departure
item.description: After one hit collection, the designer Dario Vitale will be leaving the brand. What’s going on?
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Chanel Brings a Great Métiers d’Art Show to the NYC Subway
item.description: ASAP Rocky, Jon Bon Jovi and Teyana Taylor hop aboard the C train as Matthieu Blazy brings a great Métiers d’Art show to New York.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Pantone’s 2026 Color of the Year Is ‘Cloud Dancer’
item.description: A shade of white will be the defining color of the next year. Get those stain-removing pens ready.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

item.title: Chris Black Is Known for His Taste. Now You Can Buy It.
item.description: Chris Black, host of the pop culture podcast “How Long Gone,” made the capsule wardrobe he wanted to see in the world.
item.dc:creator: Max Berlinger
item.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
item.media:description: “I have a point of view,” Chris Black said with a shrug. “And I’m not afraid to share it.”

item.title: Spotify Wrapped Has Users Talking About Their ‘Listening Age’
item.description: The wrinkle in this year’s Spotify Wrapped release was an estimate of the user’s “listening age.” Some wore it like a badge of honor. Others made excuses.
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher

item.title: Miley Cyrus and Maxx Morando Are Engaged
item.description: The Grammy Award-winning singer debuted a 14-karat gold, cushion-set natural diamond ring while posing with her longtime boyfriend at the Los Angeles premiere of “Avatar: Fire and Ash.”
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang

item.title: Is Jennifer Welch the Democrats’ Toughest Critic?
item.description: The reality TV celebrity turned left-wing podcaster Jennifer Welch is fed up with President Trump. She also expects better from the Democrats.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Hess
item.media:credit: Danielle Amy for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jennifer Welch co-hosts the podcast “I’ve Had It,” where she brings on guests like Rahm Emanuel and Hakeem Jeffries and doesn’t let them off the hook.

item.title: I Let Reddit Choose My Wedding Dress — and They Got It Right
item.description: Sometimes it’s easier to talk to strangers, which might explain why the platform has become an increasingly popular resource for wedding planning.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Diamond
item.media:credit: Irena Rudovska/iStock; Thomas Fuller/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images; Illustration by The New York Times

item.title: The Most Stylish People of 2025
item.description: Journalists from The New York Times Styles desk give their picks for the most stylish people of 2025.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk, Edward Vega and Chevaz Clarke

item.title: The 67 Most Stylish People of 2025
item.description: They appeared on courts and carpets, stages and sidelines, screens big and small. And they all shaped notions of style and self-expression.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

item.title: With MaXhosa Africa, Laduma Ngxokolo Is Reweaving South Africa’s Story
item.description: Laduma Ngxokolo, the designer behind MaXhosa Africa, is on a mission to embrace his country’s history and traditions, rather than hide from them.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi
item.media:description: Laduma Ngxokolo founded MaXhosa Africa in 2010, basing the label’s offerings on traditional Xhosa patterns and motifs, but reimagined for the modern world.

item.title: Pam Hogg, Iconoclastic Scottish Designer, Dies at 74
item.description: She was a star of London’s post-punk D.I.Y. fashion, art and performance scene, and dressed a generation of rock stars in her otherworldly handmade clothes.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green
item.media:description: Pam Hogg in 2010. She refused to alter her vision or be influenced by market forces. “I’m giving them what they don’t know they want,” she told the BBC.

item.title: How to Save Money on Your Wedding With Budgeting Tips From Married Couples
item.description: From skipping a professional florist in favor of store-bought flowers to swapping a formal dinner for a food truck, newlyweds share tips that kept their budgets intact.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan

item.title: Why Are Weddings So Expensive?
item.description: There’s no getting around it; weddings can be pricey. Here’s a breakdown of the costs.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Manners
item.media:credit: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

item.title: Frank Gehry, Titan of Architecture, Is Dead at 96
item.description: He designed some of the world’s most recognizable buildings, notably the spectacular Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, his masterpiece.
item.dc:creator: Nicolai Ouroussoff
item.media:description: Frank Gehry en 2003, en una ceremonia de inauguración de la Sala de Conciertos Walt Disney de Los Ángeles, uno de los muchos edificios célebres que diseñó en todo el mundo.

item.title: Dashing Through a Season of Holiday Movies
item.description: For one writer, putting together her annual roundup of streaming holiday movies requires open-mindedness — and a high tolerance for candy-coated clichés.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr

item.title: It Took Them Five Months to Meet. Then Only Six Weeks to Commit.
item.description: Sabrina Soto, a former HGTV host, and Nate Whitney, an MLB physical therapist, had a slow start to a speedy commitment.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: She Needed Help Setting Up Appliances. Her Future Husband Knocked at the Door.
item.description: When Melissa Cormier first met Devon Mistry in her high-rise, he was the construction manager who offered a helping hand.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang

item.title: On His Healing Journey, He Wrote 300 Letters to His Future Wife
item.description: Laterras Whitfield, the host of the hit podcast “Dear Future Wifey,” revealed his longtime partner, Ashley Woods, to fans as she walked down the aisle during a ceremony streamed to thousands.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: Healing My Heart for 20 Dollars a Month
item.description: Raised on a commune, I resisted technology at every step. Until it saved me.
item.dc:creator: Adele Uddo

item.title: From New York Beginnings to a Palm Beach Wedding
item.description: A long-distance start didn’t deter Emily Kelly and Jordan Bargas, who built a life together between New York and Florida and married at the Flagler Museum.
item.dc:creator: Donna Kim

item.title: At Gucci, Demna Brings Back the Tom Ford Era
item.description: The label’s latest collection provides another, potentially trendsetting, clue about where the luxury brand is headed.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman and Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Inside the Alvin Ailey Gala: Ciara, the Red Carpet and a Madonna Dance Party
item.description: Alvin Ailey’s annual gala began with suits and bare chests on the red carpet and ended with dancing to Madonna’s “Like a Prayer.”
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Lanna Apisukh

item.title: How Can I Support My Therapist After a Tragedy?
item.description: I don’t know how personal I should get with my mental health provider.
item.dc:creator: Lori Gottlieb

item.title: Steve Cropper, Guitarist, Songwriter and Shaper of Memphis Soul Music, Dies at 84
item.description: As a member of Booker T. & the MG’s and as a producer, he played a pivotal role in the rise of Stax Records, a storied force in R&B in the 1960s and ’70s.
item.dc:creator: Bill Friskics-Warren
item.category: (Sittin' On) The Dock of the Bay (Song)
item.media:description: Steve Cropper in 1973. His guitar licks could be heard in hits by Otis Redding, Sam & Dave and Wilson Pickett, among many others.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘He Was 75. I Was 42.’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: My Fiancé and I Don’t Drink. How Should We Deal With Booze at Our Wedding?
item.description: A reader is unsure how to guard against the possibility of drunken wedding guests while still letting social drinkers have a good time.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: Spotify Wrapped Isn’t the Only App Quantifying Our Social Lives
item.description: The music streaming service is no longer the only company quantifying our social lives.
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher
item.media:description: Spotify Wrapped helped turn end-of-year digital debriefs — summarizing users’ online and social habits — into an annual tradition.

item.title: Elias Medini Wears Naked Jean Paul Gaultier Bodysuit to Fashion Awards
item.description: In the celebrity-style ecosystem, there are no gold stars for good taste.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher
item.media:description: Elias Medini, a.k.a. Lyas, in the Jean Paul Gaultier bodysuit that shocked the red carpet at the Fashion Awards.

item.title: Finding the Magic, Just in Time (Encore)
item.description: Clare Cory was 59 years old and had been single almost her whole life. She thought her love story was over. Then everything changed.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin, Reva Goldberg, Emily Lang, Davis Land, Christina Djossa, Amy Pearl, Sara Curtis, Elisa Gutierrez, Jen Poyant, Lynn Levy, Daniel Ramirez and Dan Powell
item.media:credit: Illustration by The New York Times, Inset Illustration by Brian Rea

item.title: See All the Stars at the Gotham Awards: Elle Fanning, Hugh Jackman and More
item.description: It was all roast beef, chocolate cake and air kisses at the Gotham Awards in Lower Manhattan.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Rebecca Smeyne
item.media:credit: Rebecca Smeyne for The New York Times

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: ‘E.T.' Overalls
item.description: The owner of a bar in Tokyo said that the 1980s sci-fi film had long influenced her personal style.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: I Made an Offensive Joke. But So Did Everyone Else! Why Did I Get Fired?
item.description: Plus, should you endure a stultifying work life to enable a happy personal life?
item.dc:creator: Max Read
item.media:credit: Photo illustration by Margeaux Walter for The New York Times

item.title: Best Clothing Stores in the Country
item.description: We selected the 50 best clothing stores in the United States. Five reporters from the New York Times Style section describe how we chose them.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz, Misty White Sidell, Gina Cherelus, Alex Vadukul, Sadiba Hasan, Gabby Bulgarelli, Sutton Raphael, Jillian Eugenios, Thomas Vollkommer and Laura Salaberry
